reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Partnership for containment of artemisinin resistance and moving towards the elimination of plasmodium in Thailand

description.narrative: Malaria has been a major health problem in Thailand for more than 50 years. This Program will focus on malaria control for vulnerable populations in endemic areas and the containment of artemisinin resistance. The goal of this Program will move towards the elimination of Plasmodium falciparum malaria parasites in Thailand, with the aim of reaching the targets of the Global Malaria Action Plan (GMAP) and the Global Millennium Development Goals by 2015. The Program will target the Thai population in A1 (perennial malaria transmission occurs every year during at least 6 months of the year) and A2 (transmission occurs every year but during less than 6 months of the year) areas plus communities living in conflict zones (Yala, Narathiwat and Songkhla provinces) and the migrant population. This is a consolidation of Round 10 and Round 7 malaria grants.

title.narrative: VC -Other 2: % of population at risk (A1 + A2) covered by LLIN distribution
CM -other 2: % of confirmed uncomplicated Plasmodium vivax malaria that received antimalarial treatment according to national guidelines
VC -Other 1: Number of LLINs and LLIHNs distributed to Thai and M1, M2 migrants and refugee in camps
CM -other 1: % of confirmed uncomplicated Plasmodium falciparum malaria cases that received artemisinin-based combination therapy (ACT)
CM -other 7: % of parasitological confirmed malaria cases investigated in 27 target provinces
CM -other 3: % of confirmed uncomplicated Plasmodium falciparum malaria cases treated with ACT by DOTS in target areas
CM -other 6: Number of people screened through passive case detection (PCD)
CM -other 5: Number of people screened through active cases detection (ACD).
Malaria I-Other 1: Number of malaria cases per 1,000 population among Thai and non-Thai M1 migrants
Malaria I-Other 3:Number of deaths due to malaria
Malaria I-Other 2: Number of malaria cases per 1,000 population among refugees in camps
Malaria I-Other 4: % of target villages in which malaria transmission is interrupted at least 3 years
Malaria O-Other 1: % of population (Thai, M1 migrants, and camp residents) in target areas sleeping under ITNs (LLIHN/LLIN/re-impregnated bed nets) the previous night
Malaria O-Other 2: % of households at risk of malaria (A1 + A2) with at least one LLIN/ITN and/or sprayed by IRS in the last 12 months
Malaria O-Other 1: % of confirmed uncomplicated Plasmodium falciparum malaria that received artemisinine-based combination therapy (ACT)
